page.title: 13SWANSEA DOCKS
page.content: SWANSEA DOCKS At present there are 3 docks which make up the Port of Swansea: The Prince of Wales, The King's and TheQueen's Docks. Only the last two come within our area of study. Swansea has been associated with the sea for many hundreds of years, but it was only during the C18th that docks were built to handle increasing trade caused especially by the growing metallurgical industries which sprang up alongside the river and in the Port Tennant area itself. In 1909 a larger dock (the King's) was opened to handle the increasing volume of coal and general cargo going through the Port. The early years of the century saw industry begin to change to oil from coal as a source of energy and the first oil refinery to be built in the U.K. was opened at
